roleset.name: to perform or carry out, perform, carry out, set up
roleset.note: STAGE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'stage' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Roleset corresponds to VN class create 26.4-1 and establish-55.5. Frames created by Olga (from stage.01-v)
STAGING-N NOTES: Based on ontonotes nouns. Comparison to stage.01-v. Stage.01 is a memebr of VN classes create-6.4-1 and establist-55.5. Framed by Katie. (from staging.02-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: In East Berlin , Communist Party officials considered [*] legalizing New Forum , the country 's largest opposition alliance , as about 20,000 demonstrators staged protests in three cities [*]to press demands for democratic freedoms .
example.arg: [*] to press demands for democratic freedoms

example.name: transitive with adverbials
example.text: For [Ms. Bogart , who [*T*-1] initially studied and directed in Germany ( and cites such European directors as Peter Stein , Giorgio Strehler and Ariane Mnouchkine as influences )]-2 tends [*-2] to stage her productions with a Brechtian rigor -- whether the text demands it or not .
example.arg: whether the text demands it or not

example.name: performing
example.text: Such manipulative staging of the classics

roleset.name: determine the progression of a disease
roleset.note: STAGE-V NOTES: Based on medical data. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from stage.02-v)
STAGING-N NOTES: Based on medical data. Comparison to stage-v. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from staging.01-n)

example.name: with arg 2, often this is just '3 of 4'
example.text: The patient was staged at a t4 n2 mp resected colon adenocarcinoma
example.arg: at a t4 n2 mp resected colon adenocarcinoma

example.name: arg 1 as a whole person
example.text: We will stage her with a liver ultrasound

example.name: most common: arg 1 only
example.text: I discussed staging of colon cancer

example.name: with gol
example.text: her AJCC staging at pT2 NO
